{"step_by_step_thinking": "The clinical scenario describes a 29-year-old woman at 35 weeks' gestation who presents with absent fetal heartbeats on admission and subsequent confirmation of fetal demise. The physical examination of the infant reveals no visible malformations. Given these findings, the most appropriate next step in management would be to obtain photographs, x-ray imaging, and MRI (Choice C) to evaluate for any possible anatomical abnormalities that may have contributed to the fetal demise. This step would help identify any structural abnormalities that may have caused the fetal demise and provide valuable information for counseling the parents regarding future pregnancies.", "answer_choice": "C"}
